melee: bite +13 (1d10+5/19-20 plus 1d6 acid and corrupting bite), 2 claws +12 (1d6+5)
feats: Diehard, Endurance, Iron Will, Weapon Focus (bite)
senses: darkvision 120 ft., see in darkness; Perception +1

sections.body: A slaugrak's caustic saliva is infused with the corrupting power of the Abyss. Any living creature that takes acid damage from a slaugrak's bite must succeed at a DC 17 Fortitude save or take 2 points of Constitution bleed damage as its blood boils and its internal organs liquefy. Creatures without a discernible anatomy (blood and internal organs) are immune to the Constitution bleed. The save DC is Constitution-based.
sections.name: Corrupting Bite

sections.body: A slaugrak's bite attack threatens a critical hit on a roll of 19–20.
sections.name: Vicious Jaws

sections.body: The taint of demonkind has long corrupted the troglodyte bloodline. Each generation a few mutant creatures marked with the taint of the Abyss are born, and fiendish deformities and stillbirths reeking of brimstone are all too common. The rapacious slaugrak is one of these fiendish mutants.

A slaugrak is born with an unnatural and incessant hunger for living flesh. Young slaugraks grow at an unnatural rate, reaching full and awful maturity in just 2 weeks. From birth, a slaugrak is little more than a walking collection of fangs and claws with no thought other than to slay and eat.

Slaugraks are sterile and solitary, holding no special love for troglodytes. A well-fed captive slaugrak might form an affectionate bond with its troglodyte keeper, but this affection merely makes the slaugrak more likely to eat its keeper last.
A typical slaugrak stands 12 to 14 feet tall and weighs 6,000 pounds.

name: Slaugrak
skills: Climb +12, Intimidate +13, Stealth +8 (+12 in rocky areas), Swim +12
